content.description:
Anchises foretells the future of Rome.

1 “Tu regere imperio populos, Romane, memento

(hae tibi erunt artes), pacique imponere morem,

parcere subiectis et debellare superbos.”

Sic pater Anchises, atque haec mirantibus addit:

5“Aspice, ut insignis spoliis Marcellus opimis

ingreditur victorque viros supereminet omnes.

Hic rem Romanam magno turbante tumultu

sistet eques, sternet Poenos Gallumque rebellem,

tertiaque arma patri suspendet capta Quirino.”
content.question: What were the spolia opima (mentioned in line 5) ?

choices.label: Medals that a Roman commander awarded to soldiers for bravery in battle.
Symbols of power that lictors carried before Roman magistrates in public processions.
The weapons and armor of an opposing commander defeated in hand-to-hand combat.
The treasures seized from the royal palace of one of Rome’s conquered enemies.

content.answer: The weapons and armor of an opposing commander defeated in hand-to-hand combat.
